grokipedia_article.title: East
grokipedia_article.summary:
Fact-checked by Grok

14 hours ago

East

East is one of the four principal cardinal directions, defined as the general direction of sunrise and the point on a

compass

directly opposite to west, located 90 degrees clockwise from north.

The term originates from

Old English

ēast

, derived from Proto-Germanic

austą

, meaning "dawn" or "toward the sunrise," reflecting its ancient association with the rising sun in

Indo-European languages

.

In

navigation

and

geography

, east serves as...
